Modeling

This section contains the training, prediction, and evaluation routines.

  • Train

  • Predict

  • Evaluate

Train

The training module handles the model training pipeline.

Script for training a machine learning model using PyTorch.

This script includes functionality to: - Define and apply data augmentation transformations. - Split datasets into training, validation, and testing sets. - Define the model architecture. - Train the model using a specified number of epochs. - Save the trained model for later inference or evaluation.

Modules:

  • Path: Provides easy manipulation of filesystem paths.

  • typer: Facilitates the creation of CLI commands.

  • logger (loguru): Adds advanced logging capabilities.

  • tqdm: Displays progress bars for loops.

  • torch and torchvision: PyTorch libraries for deep learning.

  • photomacros: Custom dataset utilities.

class modeling.train.CheckpointModule(module)[source]

Bases: Module

Wrapper class for implementing gradient checkpointing on a module.

Args:

module (torch.nn.Module): PyTorch module to be wrapped.

forward(*inputs)[source]

Forward pass using gradient checkpointing.

Args:

inputs: Input tensors for the forward pass.

modeling.train.get_augmentation_transforms()[source]

Define and return data augmentation transformations for training.

Returns:

torchvision.transforms.Compose: A sequence of augmentations to apply to training data.

modeling.train.get_model_architecture(image_size, num_classes)[source]

Define and return the model architecture.

Args:

image_size (int): Input image size (assumes square images). num_classes (int): Number of output classes.

Returns:

torch.nn.Sequential: Model architecture.

modeling.train.get_validation_transforms()[source]

Define and return transformations for validation and testing.

Returns:

torchvision.transforms.Compose: Transformations to apply to validation and test data.

modeling.train.load_data(input_data_dir)[source]

Load the dataset, apply transformations, and save test data for inference.

Args:

input_data_dir (Path): Path to the input dataset directory.

Returns:

tuple: DataLoaders for training, validation, and testing datasets.

modeling.train.main(input_path=PosixPath('/Users/osmarg/Documents/GitHub/data/processed'), model_path=PosixPath('/Users/osmarg/Documents/GitHub/photomacros/docs/models/model.pkl'))[source]

Main function to train the model and save the trained model.

Args:

input_path (Path): Path to the input dataset directory. model_path (Path): Path to save the trained model.

Parameters:

  • input_path (Path)

  • model_path (Path)

modeling.train.split_data(input_data_dir, train_ratio=0.6, val_ratio=0.2, test_ratio=0.2)[source]

Split the dataset into training, validation, and testing sets.

Args:

input_data_dir (Path): Path to the dataset directory. train_ratio (float): Fraction of the dataset for training. val_ratio (float): Fraction of the dataset for validation. test_ratio (float): Fraction of the dataset for testing.

Returns:

tuple: Training, validation, and testing datasets.

modeling.train.train_model(train_loader)[source]

Train the model using the training DataLoader.

Args:

train_loader (DataLoader): DataLoader for the training dataset.

Returns:

torch.nn.Sequential: Trained model.

Predict

The prediction module handles generating predictions from the trained model.

modeling.predict.main(model_path=PosixPath('/Users/osmarg/Documents/GitHub/photomacros/docs/models/model.pkl'), predictions_path=PosixPath('/Users/osmarg/Documents/GitHub/data/processed/test_predictions.pt'), test_data_path=PosixPath('/Users/osmarg/Documents/GitHub/photomacros/docs/models/test_data.pt'), test_labels_output_path=PosixPath('/Users/osmarg/Documents/GitHub/data/processed/test_labels.csv'))[source]

Main function to perform inference and save predictions with labels.

Parameters:

  • model_path (Path) – Path, optional Path to the trained model file.

  • predictions_path (Path) – Path, optional Path to save predictions (default: test_predictions.pt).

  • test_data_path (Path) – Path, optional Path to the test dataset.

  • test_labels_output_path (Path) – Path, optional Path to save the CSV file with test labels and predictions.

Returns:

None Performs inference and saves results.

modeling.predict.perform_inference(model_path, test_data_path, predictions_path, batch_size=5)[source]

Perform inference on the test dataset using a trained model and save predictions to a file.

Parameters:

  • model_path (Path) – Path Path to the trained model file (.pkl or .pth).

  • test_data_path (Path) – Path Path to the saved test dataset.

  • predictions_path (Path) – Path Path to save the predictions.

  • batch_size (int) – int, optional (default=5) Batch size for the DataLoader.

Returns:

None Saves predictions to the specified path.

modeling.predict.save_test_labels(predictions, test_data_path, output_path)[source]

Save predictions and corresponding labels to a file.

Parameters:

  • predictions – list List of predicted labels.

  • test_data_path (Path) – Path Path to the test dataset file.

  • output_path (Path) – Path Path to save the labeled predictions.

Returns:

None Saves a CSV file with columns: image, ground_truth_label, predicted_label.

Evaluate

The evaluation module is responsible for assessing model performance.

modeling.evaluate.evaluate_predictions(predictions, ground_truth_labels)[source]

Compare the model’s predictions with ground truth labels and calculate evaluation metrics.

Args:

predictions (torch.Tensor or list): Predicted class indices (output from the model). ground_truth_labels (pd.DataFrame): DataFrame containing the ground truth labels. Expects a column “ground_truth_label”.

Returns:
tuple: (accuracy, report)

  • accuracy (float): Overall accuracy score as a decimal.

  • report (dict): Classification report as a dictionary with metrics like precision, recall, f1-score, etc.

modeling.evaluate.load_ground_truth(test_labels_path)[source]

Load ground truth labels for the test dataset.

Args:

test_labels_path (Path): Path to the CSV file containing the ground truth labels.

Returns:
pd.DataFrame: A pandas DataFrame containing the test labels.

Assumes the CSV contains a column “ground_truth_label”.

modeling.evaluate.load_predictions(predictions_path)[source]

Load predictions saved as a PyTorch tensor file.

Args:

predictions_path (Path): Path to the saved predictions file (.pt).

Returns:

torch.Tensor: Predictions as a PyTorch tensor.

modeling.evaluate.main(predictions_path=PosixPath('/Users/osmarg/Documents/GitHub/data/processed/test_predictions.pt'), test_labels_path=PosixPath('/Users/osmarg/Documents/GitHub/data/processed/test_labels.csv'), metrics_output_path=PosixPath('/Users/osmarg/Documents/GitHub/photomacros/docs/reports/metrics.json'))[source]

Main function to evaluate predictions and save the metrics as a JSON file.

Args:

predictions_path (Path): Path to the .pt file containing the model’s predictions. test_labels_path (Path): Path to the CSV file containing ground truth labels. metrics_output_path (Path): Path to save the evaluation metrics as a JSON file.

Outputs:

Saves the evaluation metrics (accuracy and classification report) to the specified JSON file.

Parameters:

  • predictions_path (Path)

  • test_labels_path (Path)

  • metrics_output_path (Path)
